issues.title: EXCEPTION_ACCESS_VIOLATION  when FFmpegFrameGrabber.grab()
EXCEPTION_ACCESS_VIOLATION  when use FFmpegFrameGrabber.grab
frame image data Incomplete :-)
DnnSuperResImpl throws java.lang.UnsatisfiedLinkError
Grabber hangs with multithreading
issues.body:
Hi, 
I use grabber.startUnsafe() function for multithreading method. But when I add about 400 streams per second to grab, some streams will hang at the startUnsafe function.
Is there any cocurrent limit for javacv or ffmpeg?

issues.title: FFmpegFrameGrabber.start()  failed  in v1.5.1

FFmpegFrameGrabber.start()  failed  in  v1.5.1，v1.5  is up and running。

PipedInputStream pis；
grabber = new FFmpegFrameGrabber(pis);
grabber.start();//always waiting

issues.title: Javacpp 1.5 build failed with Gradle
issues.body:
Following configuration work perfect with Javacpp 1.4.x
```
tasks.compileJava.doLast {
    def projectDir = project.projectDir.absolutePath
    def jsonCppIncludeDir = "$projectDir/../external/modules/jsoncpp/include"
    javaexec {
        main 'org.bytedeco.javacpp.tools.Builder'
        classpath files(configurations.javacpp.asPath)
        args '-cp', tasks.compileJava.destinationDir,
             "-Dplatform.includepath=$projectDir/src/main/cpp:$jsonCppIncludeDir",
             "-Dplatform.root=$System.env.NDK/toolchains/llvm/prebuilt/linux-x86_64",
             '-Dplatform.compiler=bin/clang++',
             "-Dplatform.compiler.default=-O3 -s",
             '-Dplatform.compiler.output=-D__ANDROID_API__=28 -DANDROID -ffunction-sections -funwind-tables -fstack-protector-strong -target aarch64-linux-android28 -march=armv8-a -Wall -static-libstdc++ -fPIC -shared -Wl,--no-undefined -z text -o\u0020',
             '-Dplatform.link=log',
             "-Dplatform.compiler.srcJsonCpp=${jsonCppSource()}",
             '-Dplatform.library.path=lib/arm64-v8a/'
    }
}
```
But I got build failed exception as below since I upgrade Javacpp version to 1.5.x
```
> Task :library:compileJava FAILED
JavaCPP version 1.5.1
Copyright (C) 2011-2019 Samuel Audet <samuel.audet@gmail.com>
Project site: https://github.com/bytedeco/javacpp

Usage: java -jar javacpp.jar [options] [class or package (suffixed with .* or .**)] [commands]

where options include:

    -classpath <path>      Load user classes from path
    -encoding <name>       Character encoding used for input and output files
    -d <directory>         Output all generated files to directory
    -o <name>              Output everything in a file named after given name
    -clean                 Delete the output directory before generating anything in it
    -nogenerate            Do not try to generate C++ source files, only try to parse header files
    -nocompile             Do not compile or delete the generated C++ source files
    -nodelete              Do not delete generated C++ JNI files after compilation
    -header                Generate header file with declarations of callbacks functions
    -copylibs              Copy to output directory dependent libraries (link and preload)
    -copyresources         Copy to output directory resources listed in properties
    -jarprefix <prefix>    Also create a JAR file named "<prefix>-<platform>.jar"
    -properties <resource> Load all platform properties from resource
    -propertyfile <file>   Load all platform properties from file
    -D<property>=<value>   Set platform property to value
    -Xcompiler <option>    Pass option directly to compiler

and where optional commands include:

    -exec [args...]        After build, call java command on the first class
    -print <property>      Print the given platform property, for example, "platform.includepath", and exit
                           "platform.includepath" has jni.h, jni_md.h, etc, and "platform.linkpath", the jvm library


Deprecated Gradle features were used in this build, making it incompatible with Gradle 6.0.
Use '--warning-mode all' to show the individual deprecation warnings.
See https://docs.gradle.org/5.4.1/userguide/command_line_interface.html#sec:command_line_warnings
1 actionable task: 1 executed
<-------------> 0% WAITING
> :library:compileJava

FAILURE: Build failed with an exception.
```
Is there any migration guide for Gradle users?

issues.title: A bug in javacv 1.5.1 but not in 1.3.3
Fix for CVE-2019-15939
issues.body:
A devide by zero error has been found in opencv: https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2019-15939

It has already been fixedin a new version of opencv.

Please provide version with updated dependencies. Thanks!

issues.title: FFmpegFrameGrabber's start method does not run
error -22: Could not encode audio packet.
issues.body:
Hi guys!I got a problem here, when i use ffmpegframeRecorder, i input a mp3 audio and output as outputstream, but i will block at recorder.stop()the error is could not encode audio packet

   
    Input #0, mp3, from 'hua.mp3':
Metadata:
encoder : Lavf58.11.101
Duration: 00:02:15.00, start: 0.069063, bitrate: 128 kb/s
Stream #0:0: Audio: mp3, 16000 Hz, mono, fltp, 128 kb/s
[mp3float @ 0x7f49f84b9f80] Could not update timestamps for skipped samples.
Output #0, mp3, to '':
Metadata:
TSSE : Lavf58.20.100
Stream #0:0: Audio: mp3, 16000 Hz, mono, fltp, 64 kb/s
[libmp3lame @ 0x7f49f8f8e280] inadequate AVFrame plane padding
[libmp3lame @ 0x7f49f8f8e280] 4 frames left in the queue on closing
[2019-09-06 17:30:00.321] ERROR [stream-service-1] StreamProcessService.java:131 - avcodec_encode_audio2() error -22: Could not encode audio packet.



The source code is :

 
FFmpegFrameRecorder recorder = new FFmpegFrameRecorder(outputStream, 1);
recorder.setFormat("mp3");
recorder.setFrameRate(grabber.getFrameRate());
recorder.setAudioCodec(avcodec.AV_CODEC_ID_MP3);
recorder.setSampleRate(grabber.getSampleRate());
it will crash when i call recoder.stop()

commitsDetails.commitMessage:
* Fix `FFmpegFrameRecorder` failing to encode `float` samples in MP3 (issue #1294)
 * Upgrade dependencies for OpenBLAS 0.3.7

issues.title: avcodec_open2() error -22. Thread-safety problem

commitsDetails.commitMessage:
* Add `FFmpegFrameRecorder.flush()` method that does not release the stream (issue #1149)
 * Readd `synchronized` blocks for `FFmpegFrameGrabber` and `FFmpegFrameRecorder`, but make unsafe methods public (issue #1139)

issues.title: vflip fliter throws an exception on FFmpegFrameFilter
issues.body:
Hi
I have one bug report and question.

I'm using javacv as FFmpeg wrapper.
I received raw video frames and tried to flip frames when encoding, but using vflip fliter throws an exception.

```Java
java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
	at java.nio.Buffer.limit(Buffer.java:275)
	at org.bytedeco.javacv.FFmpegFrameFilter.pull(FFmpegFrameFilter.java:359)
```

On debugging,I identified the cause.
With vflip filter, the imageStride of the frame returned by ffmpeg will be negative.

https://github.com/bytedeco/javacv/blob/51c5714faa487584c88be7dee8743e20cc3bc5f1/src/main/java/org/bytedeco/javacv/FFmpegFrameFilter.java#L582-L588

This process doesn't seem to consider it.
So I changed code to use absolute value and it works fine.
```Java
if (ptr != null && !ptr.equals(image_ptr[0])) { 
     image_ptr[0] = ptr.capacity(frame.imageHeight * Math.abs(frame.imageStride)); 
     image_buf[0] = ptr.asBuffer(); 
 } 
 frame.image = image_buf; 
 frame.image[0].position(0).limit(frame.imageHeight *  Math.abs(frame.imageStride)); 
 frame.imageChannels = frame.imageStride / Math.abs(frame.imageWidth);
```

I didn't use OpenCV flip function because process of converting array to mat and converting it to FFmpeg frame looks inefficiency.
Was it good choice?

Thank you.

I know, that it sounds more like a StackOverflow question but it looks like it is impossible to get a reply on a JavaCV topic there

issues.body:
Hello guys.

I have a "bad encoded" video file https://www.dropbox.com/s/3t3dmzpzsvc8aea/Do_not_use_this_movie.mp4?dl=1

When Im executing this code
```

            video.start();
            Frame frame;
            while (video.getTimestamp() <= video.getLengthInTime() && (frame = video.grab()) != null) {
                // just iterate
            }
        }
    }
```

Im getting 
```
Exception in thread "main" java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
	at java.nio.Buffer.limit(Buffer.java:275)
	at org.bytedeco.javacv.FFmpegFrameGrabber.processImage(FFmpegFrameGrabber.java:777)

                Frame frame;
                while (video.getTimestamp() <= video.getLengthInTime() && (frame = video.grab()) != null) {
                    rec.record(frame);

java(14157,0x70000534c000) malloc: *** error for object 0x1413131313131013: pointer being freed was not allocated

issues.title: How to play audio with javacv?
issues.body:
I followed the samples on github, which use:
```
FloatBuffer channelSamplesFloatBuffer = (FloatBuffer) frame.samples[0];
```
When I run the code there is an exception says that cannot convert `DirectShortBufferU` to `FloatBuffer`.
I also tried `frame.samples[0].array()` and there is another exception. I googled and find that although this DirectShortBufferU extends ShortBuffer but there is no method array().
I tried some other ways too, but the audio quality is unsatisfying (actually very bad). Any ideas on how to fix it?

Thanks!

commitsDetails.commitMessage: * Update `JavaFxPlayVideoAndAudio` sample to support `FrameGrabber.sampleMode` property (issue #820)

issues.title: Calling FFmpegFrameRecorder.record() with pixel format AV_PIX_FMT_NV21 results in wrong output
issues.body:
I am using the FFmpegFrameRecorder to record the camera output on Android. When I use the `record(frame)` method the output looks normal. However, when I use `record(frame, avutil.AV_PIX_FMT_NV21)` then the output is wrong.

I think the reason for that is because `step = width;` in [FFmpegFrameRecorder.java#L892](https://github.com/bytedeco/javacv/blob/master/src/main/java/org/bytedeco/javacv/FFmpegFrameRecorder.java#L892) is only executed if the pixel format is set to AV_PIX_FMT_NONE which is the case when using `record(frame)`. However when setting the pixel format directly with `record(frame, avutil.AV_PIX_FMT_NV21)` then this is missing which might cause the wrong output.

commitsDetails.commitMessage: * Prevent `FFmpegFrameGrabber.setTimestamp()` from going into an infinite loop (issue #731)

issues.title: frame.timestamp always is 0
FFmpegFrameFilter doesn't work for "fps" filter
FFmpegFrameRecorder.stop() sometimes causes app crashing

issues.title: overlay a image on video does not working
issues.body:
Hello Samuel, I try to overlay a image on video. But does not working for me. Can you help me? 

this is my code:

mVideoGrabber.start();
            mVideoRecorder = new FFmpegFrameRecorder(mDirectory +"/video" + System.currentTimeMillis() + ".mp4", mVideoGrabber.getImageWidth(), mVideoGrabber.getImageHeight(), audioChannel);
            mVideoRecorder.setVideoCodec(avcodec.AV_CODEC_ID_H264);
            mVideoRecorder.setVideoBitrate(mBitRate);
            mVideoRecorder.start();
            try{
                mFilter = new FFmpegFrameFilter("movie="+ file.getAbsolutePath() +" [logo];[in][logo]overlay=0:0:format=rgb[out]",mVideoGrabber.getImageWidth(), mVideoGrabber.getImageHeight());
                mFilter.start();
            } catch (FrameFilter.Exception e){
                Log.e(TAG,"Error while starting filter: "+e.getMessage());
                e.printStackTrace();
            }

            while ((tempVideoFrame = mVideoGrabber.grab()) != null) {
                if(mVideoGrabber.getTimestamp() > mVideoRecorder.getTimestamp())
                {
                    mVideoRecorder.setTimestamp(mVideoGrabber.getTimestamp());
                }
                if(tempVideoFrame.image!=null){
                    mFilter.push(tempVideoFrame);
                    tempVideoFrame = mFilter.pull();
                    mVideoRecorder.record(tempVideoFrame);
                }
                mVideoRecorder.record(tempVideoFrame);
            }
            mFilter.stop();
            mVideoRecorder.stop();
            mVideoRecorder.release();
            mVideoGrabber.stop();
            mVideoGrabber.release();

issues.title: Issue using RealSenseFrameGrabber
issues.body:
I encountered some problems using the RealSenseFrameGrabber class.
I have managed to display the color stream but I cannot access the depth stream which I need for my application.

in my Main i have the following:

```java
...
35 RealSenseFrameGrabber grabber = RealSenseFrameGrabber.createDefault(0);
36 grabber.tryLoad();
37 grabber.enableDepthStream();
38 grabber.start();
...
```

when I try to run the code I get:

```sh
RealSense devices found: 1
Exception in thread "main" java.lang.NullPointerException
	at org.bytedeco.javacv.RealSenseFrameGrabber.enableDepthStream(RealSenseFrameGrabber.java:156)
	at Main.main(Main.java:37)
```
RealSenseFrameGrabber.java:156
```java
device.enable_stream(RealSense.depth, depthImageWidth, depthImageHeight, RealSense.z16, depthFrameRate)
```
because nobody loaded the device variable...
 How am I supposed to use this class?

issues.title: FFmpegFrameFilter does not work.

commitsDetails.commitMessage:
* Add `setpts=N` to input of `FFmpegFrameFilter` to make `fade` and `overlay` filters behave as expected ([issue #667](https://github.com/bytedeco/javacv/issues/667))
 * Fix crash on `FFmpegFrameRecorder.stop()` when no audio samples are left to write

issues.body:
Hi,
i make project  face recogntion and build it by gradle but when  i build i have this error

home/project/hipi/examples/jcvhd/src/main/java/org/hipi/examples/HelloWorld.java:132: error: no suitable method found for predict(Mat)

                                           ^
    method FaceRecognizer.predict(Mat,IntPointer,DoublePointer) is not applicable

      (actual and formal argument lists differ in length)

      (actual and formal argument lists differ in length)

issues.title: How can i record a pcm mp4 on Android?
java.lang.NoClassDefFoundError: Could not initialize class org.bytedeco.javacpp.avutil
issues.body:
I ran into a problem using SBT with javacv-platform-1.3.1.

The problem:
The application would run fine when running from my local however when publishing and dockerizing using sbt-native-packager, inside the container I would receive:

```
"java.lang.NoClassDefFoundError: Could not initialize class org.bytedeco.javacpp.avutil"
```

Solution:

To solve it i added this to my main method 
```
    System.setProperty("org.bytedeco.javacpp.cachedir", ".");
```

I turns out there was permission errors writing to the original place its meant to write too which was: "~/.javacpp/cache/"

I then amended my docker instructions to create this file and give it the necessary permissions.

This is not a problem that would need to be solved by code, but it would be useful in documentation as a tip as it was quite frustrating to debug!

issues.title: Live Stream to HTML5 Video Tag
issues.body:
Hallo,

Is it possible to use JavaCV to live-stream a sequence of images from a FrameGrabber into an HTML5 Canvas as an html5 video stream (currently OGV, MP4, WEBM are supported from browsers). I can see that FFMPEG supports http streaming using an expiramental http server: https://ffmpeg.org/ffmpeg-protocols.html#http but how can that be possible using javacv?

Identically could it be possible to use the framegrabber on a servlet and serve Range packets using the FFMPEGRecorder?

commitsDetails.commitMessage: * Let `FFmpegFrameRecorder` pass options to the protocol as well (issue #598)

issues.title: OpenCVFrameGrabber leaks memory
issues.body:
OpenCVFrameGrabber#grab currently leaks memory and fails the identity test described in the FrameGrabber#grab documentation.

A fix is in pull request #575 . Tested in Windows 8, Ubuntu 16.04 and OSX 10.12.

I cannot build version 1.2 with gradle. When I try this:

`compile group: 'org.bytedeco', name: 'javacv', version: '1.2'`

or

`compile 'org.bytedeco:javacv:1.2'`

I get always this error:

`Could not find javacpp-presets-Mac OS X-x86_64.jar (org.bytedeco:javacpp-presets:1.2).
  Searched in the following locations:
      https://repo1.maven.org/maven2/org/bytedeco/javacpp-presets/1.2/javacpp-presets-1.2-Mac OS X-x86_64.jar`

I can build version 1.1 without problems. I checked documentation from javacpp-presets as suggested from readme, but nothing worked. I understand that in version 1.2 is used custom property "javacpp.platform", which cannot be added via gradle. I tried:

and get:

      https://repo1.maven.org/maven2/org/bytedeco/javacv/1.2/javacv-1.2-macosx-x86_64.jar`

I tested gradle build also on Linux, got same error with just different platform (Linux-amd64). So is gradle build broken, or i'm missing something?

issues.title: Obtaining a javacv build without multithreading
issues.body:
Hello!

I have enjoyed using the javacv project a great deal. It is really quite excellent getting access to OpenCV from the JVM (also tesseract and a billion other libraries!).

I am, unfortunately, running into a really nasty bug within OpenCV. I have a multi-threaded program that is attempting to use a particular function from OpenCV: `cv::cvtColor`.

Unfortunately for me,  `cv::cvtColor` is compiled with to take advantage of multiple threads to perform color conversion. This functionality is baked into the OpenCV build. Each platform has its own different backend for multithreading. There's Grand Central Dispatch (GCD) for OSX only, pthreads and OpenMP for both Linux and OSX, and the Intel Thread Building Blocks (TBB) library for Windows and Linux.

On OSX, GCD does not obey the `cv::setNumThreads(0)` semantics: it's not possible to tell GCD to not run multithreaded code with only one thread. [https://github.com/Itseez/opencv/issues/6461]

Would it be possible to collaborate and release platform-specific builds of javacv that use opencv built without any multithreading support?

If not that, then what about building javacv with opencv built with pthreads backends for both OSX and Linux?

cvRetrieveFrame() Error: Could not retrieve frame. (
Has start() been called?)
[info] org.bytedeco.javacv.FrameGrabber$Exception: cvRetrieveFrame() Error: Coul
d not retrieve frame. (Has start() been called?)
[info]  at org.bytedeco.javacv.OpenCVFrameGrabber.grab(OpenCVFrameGrabber.java:2
39)
```

I discovered this bug when trying to run this Akka example of webcam https://github.com/lloydmeta/scala-akka-cv-part1 which I came across from this blog article https://beachape.com/blog/2016/03/08/scala-and-opencv-ep-1-akka-webcam/

I fixed the bug by making this github branch https://github.com/PhilAndrew/scala-akka-cv-part1/tree/windows10 which now uses new VideoCapture(0) rather than new OpenCVFrameGrabber(0).

You can investigate the difference between the two project.

If you need more details refer to this issue. https://github.com/lloydmeta/scala-akka-cv-part1/issues/1

My machine is Intel Windows 10 with SJCAM SJ4000 setup as a USB webcam.

---

Another way to investigate this is to look at this version which works with JavaCV OpenCV 2.4.9

https://github.com/PhilAndrew/ScalaOpenCVCameraWhichWorks/tree/bbea935fa342cdb3d8016afa24c566269e4bb43d

Which when upgraded to JavaCV OpenCV 3+ does not work

https://github.com/PhilAndrew/ScalaOpenCVCameraWhichWorks/tree/opencv3

commitsDetails.commitMessage:
Merge pull request #361 from lloydmeta/feature/upgrade-opencvgrabber

 * Upgrade `OpenCVFrameGrabber` to use the new C++ `VideoCapture` API (issue #357)

issues.title: FFmpegFrameGrabber doesn't return all video frames from a video on Android 5.x
loadlibrary() give me "Couldn't load opencv_imgproc from loader dalvik.system.PathClassLoader"
issues.body: I want integrate this library in Android but is very hard...

stitching example for openvn not working, complaining about missing openvc_ffmpeg_...

issues.title: Android + OpenCV + FFmpeg
issues.body:

**proguard-rules.pro** (process from: [link](https://github.com/bytedeco/javacv/wiki/Configuring-Proguard-for-JavaCV)  ):

```
-keepattributes *Annotation*


-keep @org.bytedeco.javacpp.annotation interface * {
    *;
}

-keep @org.bytedeco.javacpp.annotation.Platform public class *

-keepclasseswithmembernames class * {
    @org.bytedeco.* <fields>;
}

-keepclasseswithmembernames class * {
    @org.bytedeco.* <methods>;
}

-keepattributes EnclosingMethod
-keep @interface org.bytedeco.javacpp.annotation.*,javax.inject.*

-keepattributes *Annotation*, Exceptions, Signature, Deprecated, SourceFile, SourceDir, LineNumberTable, LocalVariableTable, LocalVariableTypeTable, Synthetic, EnclosingMethod, RuntimeVisibleAnnotations, RuntimeInvisibleAnnotations, RuntimeVisibleParameterAnnotations, RuntimeInvisibleParameterAnnotations, AnnotationDefault, InnerClasses
-keep class org.bytedeco.javacpp.** {*;}
-dontwarn java.awt.**
-dontwarn org.bytedeco.javacv.**
-dontwarn org.bytedeco.javacpp.**
```

**Gradle:**

```
apply plugin: 'com.android.application'

android {
    compileSdkVersion 23
    buildToolsVersion "23.0.2"

    defaultConfig {
        applicationId "co.timeiseverything.pstimeiseverything"
        minSdkVersion 15
        targetSdkVersion 23
        versionCode 1
        versionName "1.0"
    }
    buildTypes {
        release {
            minifyEnabled false
            proguardFiles getDefaultProguardFile('proguard-android.txt'), 'proguard-rules.pro'
        }
    }

    packagingOptions {
        exclude 'META-INF/maven/org.bytedeco.javacpp-presets/opencv/pom.properties'
        exclude 'META-INF/maven/org.bytedeco.javacpp-presets/opencv/pom.xml'
        exclude 'META-INF/maven/org.bytedeco.javacpp-presets/ffmpeg/pom.properties'
        exclude 'META-INF/maven/org.bytedeco.javacpp-presets/ffmpeg/pom.xml'
    }
}

repositories {
    mavenCentral()
}

dependencies {
    compile fileTree(include: ['*.jar'], dir: 'libs')
    testCompile 'junit:junit:4.12'
    compile 'com.android.support:appcompat-v7:23.1.1'
    compile 'com.google.android.gms:play-services-appindexing:8.1.0'

    compile group: 'org.bytedeco', name: 'javacv', version: '1.1'
    compile group: 'org.bytedeco.javacpp-presets', name: 'opencv', version: '3.0.0-1.1', classifier: 'android-arm'
    compile group: 'org.bytedeco.javacpp-presets', name: 'opencv', version: '3.0.0-1.1', classifier: 'android-x86'
    compile group: 'org.bytedeco.javacpp-presets', name: 'ffmpeg', version: '2.8.1-1.1', classifier: 'android-arm'
    compile group: 'org.bytedeco.javacpp-presets', name: 'ffmpeg', version: '2.8.1-1.1', classifier: 'android-x86'

    compile project(':openCVLibrary310')
}
```

**jniLibs:** I have:
`app/src/main/jniLibs:
armeabi  armeabi-v7a  arm64-v8a  mips  mips64  x86  x86_64`

Could you help me please, what i am doing wrong?

issues.title: Getting "UnsatisfiedLinkError: org.bytedeco.javacpp.avutil" when using FFmpegFrameGrabber
issues.body:
Hello, 

I am getting this error whenever i attempt to start an FFmpegFrameGrabber instance. 

I am compiling the following groups...

``` groovy
compile group: 'org.bytedeco', name: 'javacv', version: '1.1'
compile group: 'org.bytedeco.javacpp-presets', name: 'opencv', version: '3.0.0-1.1', classifier: 'android-arm'
compile group: 'org.bytedeco.javacpp-presets', name: 'opencv', version: '3.0.0-1.1', classifier: 'android-x86'
compile group: 'org.bytedeco.javacpp-presets', name: 'ffmpeg', version: '2.8.1-1.1', classifier: 'android-arm'
compile group: 'org.bytedeco.javacpp-presets', name: 'ffmpeg', version: '2.8.1-1.1', classifier: 'android-x86'
```

...with these packaging options

``` groovy
packagingOptions {

        exclude 'META-INF/LICENSE.txt'
        exclude 'META-INF/NOTICE.txt'
        exclude 'META-INF/maven/org.bytedeco.javacpp-presets/ffmpeg/pom.properties'
        exclude 'META-INF/maven/org.bytedeco.javacpp-presets/ffmpeg/pom.xml'
        exclude 'META-INF/maven/org.bytedeco.javacpp-presets/opencv/pom.properties'
        exclude 'META-INF/maven/org.bytedeco.javacpp-presets/opencv/pom.xml'

    }
```

My target SDK version is 22, and I am using Android Studio on a Mac.

I have tried following the manual install instructions, even copying the .so files as stated in other issues both here and on stack overflow. I received the same error in every case.
The closest issue i could find would be #133 but all the suggestions there lead to the same result.

It is worth mentioning that creating a brand new project and importing only JavaCv as i have described above does not throw this error.

I have been stuck on this problem for much too long, any help would be greatly appreciated.

I will be happy to provide any additional required information. Thank you in advance!
### **EDIT**

I have started checking if any of my other included libraries are the problem. Through a process of elimination, i've found that including 
`compile 'io.realm:realm-android:0.87.2'`
in my project causes the error. I hope this is usefull to someone as i have no idea what to do next.
### **EDIT 2**

I have created a SO post here : http://stackoverflow.com/questions/35066470/using-javacv-and-realm-together-causes-java-lang-unsatisfiedlinkerror?noredirect=1#comment57856761_35066470

I will update it regularly

issues.title: Throwing Away The Interrupt Flag by catching the InterruptedException
issues.body:
There are at least 5 locations where this library simply catches an InterruptedException and does nothing with it.
https://github.com/bytedeco/javacv/search?utf8=%E2%9C%93&q=InterruptedException

http://www.ibm.com/developerworks/library/j-jtp05236/
How an InterruptedException should be handled in is detailed in the link above. In a nutshell, the InterruptedException should never be simply tossed away. You should always either propigate the exception or reset the threads interrupted flag.

commitsDetails.commitMessage: * Fix swallowed `InterruptedException` (issue #315)
* Throw appropriate exception in `FrameGrabber.start()` (issue #315)

issues.title: Assertion Error when using new Java2DFrameConverter
issues.body:
I'm trying to play back a GoPro MP4 file, using the new Java2DFrameConverter to create a BufferedImage

```
    FFmpegFrameGrabber grabber = new FFmpegFrameGrabber(INPUT_VIDEO);
    Java2DFrameConverter converterToBI = new Java2DFrameConverter();

    grabber.start();
    final Frame frame0 = grabber.grab();
    Preconditions.checkNotNull(frame0);
    System.out.println(Java2DFrameConverter.getBufferedImageType(frame0));
    BufferedImage bi1 = converterToBI.convert(frame0);
```

throws a NPE or Assertion Error (when I enabled assertions)

```
Exception in thread "main" java.lang.AssertionError
    at org.bytedeco.javacv.Java2DFrameConverter.getBufferedImage(Java2DFrameConverter.java:609)
    at org.bytedeco.javacv.Java2DFrameConverter.getBufferedImage(Java2DFrameConverter.java:571)

    at Merger.main(Merger.java:52)

It won't be that sad if the same problem wasn't preventing me from using the program on a different PC, where I distribute it in the form of a JAR (the JAR works fine on my PC ok for some reason, my wild guess is of having the local Maven repo with the dependencies available here).

issues.title: FrameGrabber.grab() not grabbing all frames.
issues.body:
I just updated JavaCV to 0.11 and my code stoped working. I am grabbing the frames from an mp4 file and displaying them using CanvasFrame.showImage(). This was working in the 0.10 version but is now throwing a NullPointerException. 

```
public static void main(String[] args){
    FrameGrabber frameGrabber = new FFmpegFrameGrabber("/path/to/video.mp4");
    CanvasFrame canvasFrame = new CanvasFrame("Test");

    frameGrabber.start();
    for(int i = 0; i<frameGrabber.getLengthInFrames(); i++){
         canvasFrame.showImage(frameGrabber.grab());
    }
    frameGrabber.flush();
    canvasFrame.dispose();
}
```

I tried checking to see if `frameGrabber.grab()` was returning `null` by adding this to the for loop.

```
if(frameGrabber.grab() == null){
    System.out.println("Frame is null");
}
```

But it never printed. Then I noticed in the debugger that `frameGrabber.grab()` returned an object called Frame and it had an `image` value. This is the output from when I printed the image value. 

```

commitsDetails.commitMessage:
* Add `FFmpegFrameGrabber.grabImage()` method to restore the functionality previously provided by `IplImage grab()` (issue #116)

Also add calls to `av_dict_free()` to release memory allocated for options and metadata

James

issues.title: Demo application from README does not work
issues.body:
Demo app throws exception:

```
OpenCV Error: Unspecified error (The node does not represent a user object (unknown type?)) in cvRead, file /home/saudet/projects/bytedeco/javacpp-presets/opencv/cppbuild/linux-x86_64/opencv-2.4.10/modules/core/src/persistence.cpp, line 4991
Exception in thread "main" java.lang.RuntimeException: /home/saudet/projects/bytedeco/javacpp-presets/opencv/cppbuild/linux-x86_64/opencv-2.4.10/modules/core/src/persistence.cpp:4991: error: (-2) The node does not represent a user object (unknown type?) in function cvRead
```

The reason is  xml classifier format has been changed and 2.4 branch of OpenCV has new format already.  Demo app should be pointed to `2.4.10` tag:

``` java
URL url = new URL("https://raw.githubusercontent.com/Itseez/opencv/2.4.10/data/haarcascades/haarcascade_frontalface_alt.xml");
```

commitsDetails.commitMessage: * Fix `Demo` class in the `README.md` file (issue #102)

issues.title: No avcodec in java.library.path
issues.body:
Hi, I'm developing a Java Web Application. I'm using JavaCV to capture single frames from videos, which will be uploaded by the user. This frames will serve as placeholders to the user.

I'm developing the application in the local runtime and everything is working 100% perfectly. The JavaCV is working correctly and doing everything I want. However, my problem happens when I try to publish my application in an external server.

I keep getting this error:

`java.lang.UnsatisfiedLinkError: no avcodec in java.library.path`

Again, this error only occurs in the real server. In my local runtime, everything is fine.

Additional Information:

I'm using JavaCV 0.8, and this is my maven declaration:

``` xml
<!-- JavaCV -->
<dependency>
    <groupId>org.bytedeco</groupId>
    <artifactId>javacv</artifactId>
    <version>0.8</version>
</dependency>
<dependency>
    <groupId>org.bytedeco</groupId>
    <artifactId>javacpp</artifactId>
    <version>0.8</version>
</dependency>
```

Firstly, I wasn't using the javacpp dependency. I added it later, but it isn't working both ways.

This is the code that I'm using to work with JavaCV:

``` java
FFmpegFrameGrabber fg = new FFmpegFrameGrabber(f);
fg.start();

ByteArrayOutputStream baos = new ByteArrayOutputStream();

ImageIO.write(fg.grab().getBufferedImage(), "png", baos);

fg.stop();
```

This is the error I'm getting:

``` text
Servlet.service() for servlet [mvc-dispatcher] in context with path [/ArrivalGuideCMF] threw exception [Handler processing failed; nested exception is java.lang.UnsatisfiedLinkError: no jniavcodec in java.library.path] with root cause

java.lang.UnsatisfiedLinkError: no avcodec in java.library.path

    at java.lang.ClassLoader.loadLibrary(ClassLoader.java:2018)
    at java.lang.Runtime.loadLibrary0(Runtime.java:845)
    at java.lang.System.loadLibrary(System.java:1091)
    at org.bytedeco.javacpp.Loader.loadLibrary(Loader.java:524)
    at org.bytedeco.javacpp.Loader.load(Loader.java:390)
    at org.bytedeco.javacpp.Loader.load(Loader.java:353)
    at org.bytedeco.javacpp.avcodec.<clinit>(avcodec.java:12)
    at org.bytedeco.javacv.FFmpegFrameGrabber.<clinit>(FFmpegFrameGrabber.java:103)
        ...
```

I only have the maven dependency to run JavaCV, no other external JARs are linked to my project. However, I've already tried to add ffmpeg-20130915-git-7ac6c63-windows-x86_64.jar and ffmpeg-20130915-git-7ac6c63-windows-x86.jar to my project, as I saw in this forum, but it didn't work.

One more thing: I'm using JavaCV 0.8, since this is the only version that was working for me (at least in my local runtime). JavaCV 10.0 and older versions are not working and are giving me more errors.

Any help is appreciated. I ensure you I've searched A LOT how to fix it, but nothing is working!

The server I'm publishing my application is the HCP (Hana Cloud Platform) Trial, which accepts Java Applications (just to you know)
